overview:
Carlos Justiniano is a technologist with over 25 years of industry experience. During the past two decades he’s served as consultant, lead, architect, technical manager and director roles for companies such as Disney, IBM, The Symantec - Peter Norton Group, EAI (Engineering Animation) and various startups.

In 2001 he co-founded ChessBrain, a distributed computation research project, which later went on to receive a 2005 Guinness World Record as “The World’s Largest Networked Chess Computer”.

Outside of computer programming he has written for leading technology publishers such as IBM, The Linux Journal, O’Reilly, Prentice Hall, and Springer. He’s also contributed to research papers which have been published by ACM, IEEE and featured at international conferences.
